title: infosys font
content:
I just started on a project for infosys and need to know which fonts they are using for the logo (which I assume is a commercial font that is modified) and for their body copy.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Infosys.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417022522/http:/typophile.com/files/Infosys.jpg) | 42.9 KB |
author: alchion

comments.content: The logotype is probably a customized Optima (judging from the lowercase "s" which isn't easy to draw). It could be a font also, I just can't identify it.

Hi Ole

Could be a redrawn or squished version of ITC Newtext or ITC Novarese in the logo there - the 'f' is not like Optima, but there appear to be some minute flange-type serifs and a sharpness in the hook of the 'f'.
